name: Rabasa Galan, Biel
brief:
Assuming the role of producer in this project, I learned the basics of team building, time management and task management. In addition, being part of a video game development team has taught me the importance of playtesting.

During the project, I still wanted to keep in touch with the code, as code optimisation has always been my favorite part of video game development.
contributions:
- Team organisation
- Production plan
- Player movement & camera code
- Playtesting sessions

name: Sellarés Salvador, Adrià
contributions:
- Team & tasks organization
-  Concept art
- Model & texture
- Cutscenes

name: Boces Obis, David
brief:
After working on this project, I finally can say I learned a lot. From design, build and iterate entire levels and create a complete story inside the great's Marvel universe to organise and lead an entire team after being appointed leader of the design team. 
To conclude, I must say it's been amazing to work with the people involved and all the hard work done to achieve this final result.
contributions:
- Team & tasks organisation
- Narrative writer
- Level design
- Playtesting sessions

name: Giralt Silván, Alejandro
contributions:
- UI & Menus Design
- Web Design and Code
- Level Contruction
- Worldbuilding

name: Landa Muñoz, Andreu
brief:
As a game designer I was focused on the combat mechanics, I have been designing and balancing all weapons and enemies to finish with a solid gameplay that can keep players engagment. 
I also worked in the bosses design, designing Ebony and Thanos mechanics, statistics and behaviours.
Now that this project is almost done I feel like I have improved my designer qualities and enhanced a lot the teamwork.
contributions:
- Weapons Design
- Enemies Design
- Boss Design
- Playtesting & balancing

name: Toledo Rodríguez, Daniel
brief:
Apples are red.
The sky is blue.
And this subject is a bad joke.
contributions:
- Concept Artist
- 3D Modeler
- Disruptor team member

name: Damià Rosal, Joan
brief:
As an aspiring game dev with clear preference for design before art I have to say that this project helped me see that art is a place 
where I can do a good work without causing problems to my partners. I improved my teamwork skills and gained confidence with my skills
as a 3D modeller, animator and texturizer.
Really, a quite insightful project where I feel that my journey as a game dev student is filled with knowledge, improvement and  specialy
jolly cooperation.

name: Ayora Alcañiz, Rubén
brief:
In this project I learned how important is to organice the code in order to avoid problems and bugs while working with
other people.
I also improved my bug-fixing skills and, as i have been working on that features of the project, I reinforced my knowlage about the
shooting system, learning different ways to do a shooter.
contributions:
- Player weapons, skills and power ups
- Chests and Loot system
- Enemy guns
- General gameplay bug-fixing

name: Benages Calzada, David
brief:
As part of the project code team, I have learned the importance of having a good code organization, as well as programming thinking 
about how the code may change in the future.
After working on a project as big as this one, I have finally learned the importance of communication and time organization. 
Now, I have a better vision of how to work with a team of so many people, and I feel more prepared for the professional world.
contributions:
- Engine Particle System
- Engine NavMesh
- Enemy Melee attack and Enemy Sniper implementation
- All in-game dialogs implementation
- Bug-fixing
